etymology.description: 燕(燕) (yàn, "swallow; calm") + 麦(麥) (mài, "wheat") = a grain related to wheat commonly known as oats
etymology.interpretation: 燕(燕) (yàn, "swallow; calm") and 麦(麥) (mài, "wheat") combine to describe a cereal grain that is similar in agricultural characteristics to wheat but is specifically used to refer to oats.
etymology.simplification: 燕 simplified to 燕 and 麥 simplified to 麦

examples.chinese: 我每天早上吃燕麦(我每天早上吃燕麥)。
燕麦富含蛋白质(燕麥富含蛋白質)，适合做早餐(適合做早餐)。
examples.pinyin: Yànmài fùhán dànbáizhí, shìhé zuò zǎocān.
examples.english: Oats are rich in protein and are suitable for breakfast.
